entry.title: Audio Style Transfer
entry.content:
Technically CycleGAN gives you epic results like

The code written so bad that it gave images like these.

Well not all were bad, but some are pretty awful.

So to put use of my slow laptop, i decided to apply the idea in another domain. Apply on sounds.

Wait wait….

Lets look at cycleGan first

Basic idea is you have image of one style ,you copy that style to another(Yeah like the Prisma APP which was so viral and you dowanloaded it then and you forgot to delete it. Now its just wasting space in your mobile device).

Cool thing is you only need unpaired image samples. So google some stuff copy some images and you have a dataset.

If you wanna know more read the paper. In short it has a cyclic loss with the Adversarial loss.

Our Tweak

Lets convert audio to image and apply the same thing.

So i did it on greyscale. Yes im too impatient to wait for an RGB to train to see if a hypothesis works.

So we took 20 second audio and converted to Greysacle image and applied CycleGAN.

We got this.

a) Style 1
b) Style 2 applied on Style 1
c) Style 2
d) Style 1 applied on Style 2

Turns out the unpaired image thing is pretty sweet.

Results

Style 1

Style 2 applied on Style 1

Style 2

Style 1 applied on Style 2

Yesh the second one sounds fine and fourth one ripped your ear off.

I was too lazy to convert and see it works all the time.

Well it gets good at some point of training then it starts producing results which will rip your ear off again.

Yaay good news,its works.

If you make a better network it will give you better results and maybe apply some noise filter.
Ah! ill do that another day.

Now look at this epic tiget to panther conversion.

If you have some intersting ideas comment below. Lets try some stuff.
entry.summary: So on a bright day playing with CycleGan a bit for audio style transfer.

entry.title: Nybles
entry.content:
I started a Tech newsletter

Why nybles? Why not any other name

Nybles or Nibble is a unit of information. 4 bits or 0.5 byte is a Nibble or a Nyble. Well we couldnt get the Nibble domain so we went with the other one.

A Nyble is half a byte

Why a tech newsletter? Why not a general college newletter?

IIIT Allahabad is a small college,information is can travel quickly via word of mouth over here.

On the other hand,I felt the gap between the industry or research is growing wider and wider. What i read on the internet or herd from people who are not in this College,often is an alien language to people here.

So we can say it is a “Translater”, for the Klingon the Industry speaks.

On 12 August 2017, Nybles released Version 1.0.


Nybles is now recognised as an International Tech Newsletter by the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad.

Our Journey so far

We started with beta edition of website .

View Old website Code on Github

The website was based on Jekyll. Adding an article was tedious since it required one to send a Pull request. Even though the team developed an editor to make it with ease people still found it hard.

== Closing in on Quantum Computing
12 Mar 2017
By Elaine Mary Rose - 7 min read ==

Was the first article to be published on the beta version.
During revamp we are only taking the top 5 articles based on Google Analytics to the new platform.

So after 5 months on the same date we are releasing version 1.0.

We are making some changes during this auspicious time

New website :

The new website will be served on Ghost.org .

Why Ghost?

We wanted

  • Amazing admin panel
  • Quick integration with API’s such as slack,facebook comments etc.
  • Markdown
  • You can checkout its cool other features at Ghost.org

We were using Jekyll till now, but sending pr for articles takes too much effort and learning curve for every new writer was high.

Our development goal is new develop new theme for Ghost which will suit our needs.

Chatbot :

We also developed a chat bot which you can talk to via our facebook page

Articles

  • We plan to release an article within three days
  • We would send a newsletter to everyone subscribed in every 15 or 30 days.

Future Plans

  • Mobile App to be developed using react native, Probable date of release October 2017.
  • Better integration of WebApp and Chatbot.

I’ll be stepping down from the position of Editor in Cheif from this edition. As the team is amazing now and Nybles is now live. Now ill search for another problem to solve and find my place in the Universe.

Visit Nyble at nybles.tech
Team

entry.title: HackInTheNorth2.0
entry.content:
This years Hack In the North had around 300 participants to become india’s biggest student held Hackathon, With participants coming from all over india to make the event a grand sucess.

Team

We decided early on that this year , there wont be any main organiser or anything of such sorts. Everyone will be the same and all will have equal role. This was a vital part for the event.So with a linear management we started preparing for the even 8 months prior to the event.

The team page of the event can be seen at here

Marketing

As marketing is the most vital part of making every event a sucess. This year we decided to redefine everything by changing the logo and realsed two trailers for the event. Design for everything including the posters , website etc was be minimal.

Registartion

We opened the registartion months prior to the event , so that students who are far off would get sufficent time to prepare for the event. Participants were shortlisted by their GitHub profile and Resume. Hack In the North is free for everyone although we donot provide travel rembiustments we do provide free accomodation, food and other facilities during the event.

The Opening Cermony

The opening cermony was made special by talks given by Joe Nash of GitHub, Sidarth of Startup Village, Saynthan of Fedora. During this 3 hour cermony particpants were briefed about the everything.

The Hacking

Hacking started shortly after the opening cermony and particpants were split between two labs in Computer Center 3 of IIIT Allahabad Campus.Where at which the participants hacked contiously for the next 36 hours to decide who is the winner of the event. Each Team was assigned a table number and they were also provided with beddings inside the labs as well, for those who wanted to take rest. During the hacking online sessions of RestDB and other were held.

Hacking for 36 hours

Food

Particants were provided with Pizza, Veg Biriyani, Maggi and cold drinks each day for the two days.

Goodies

Paticpants were all given T shirts, Stickers by various sponsors , Coupons for services ( such as restdb, digital ocean, Radix etc) and various other goodies. Online session by RestDB was also held during the event.

Judging

Judging of the event was done using MIT’s gavel online judge. Our two judges were from Fedora and NASDAQ. The top 10 particpants where shortlisted from the 48 teams and they were called upon on the stage for final presentation. Based on the final presentation the winners of the event was decided. Prizes were given for Winners, Best hardware hack, Best radix hack and top 10 teams.

Winners of hint 2.0 during the final judging

Sponsors

It was my third time organising a hackthon, first two although being sucessful was incomplete. It lacked an integral part, Sponsors. We had Github, Hackster.io, Gitlab, Radix, Wolframalpha, Tensorflow, Restdb and many more to fill that gapping hole this year.

Steve Jobs said you can only connect the dots backwards, that everything you did till a point in life will allign at one moment. That moment what this years Hack In The North was for us.

View more images over Ams IIIT A flickr album
entry.summary: This is how we organised india’s biggest student held hackathon.

entry.title: Opencode
entry.content:
As the new year dawned, we decided to do something different. The issue we faced was that only few people were interested in Open Source, and we had to lure them into our little cult. Hence, inspired from GSOC and GCI, we decided to organise an event named Opencode. The idea was slightly absurd - a month long event where we help participants develop Open Source software on GitHub. My team, consisting of Shubham Padia, Diwakar Vinay, Faheem Hassan Zunjani, Abhinav Khare, Pranjal Paliwal, Mubaris Hassan, Himanshu Shekhar and I, started working on 6 different projects as mentors.

The beginning

The event timeline.

Since the event was a farely new idea we wanted to increase the hype so on new years we posted , comming soon posters.

Followed by that we published the trailer and accouned the event date.

we even made a simple markdown based website for the event.

Selected Projects

Opencodecollab

View on github View Website

Opencode Collabrative website

This is was our main project, to participate in the event a user had to send a pull request adding his name in this website (Made using jeykll). Thanks to github for making the amazing jeykll project.

At the beginning the the website only had students and participants sections.

New features :

  • Card flip to show details.
  • Increased number of projects from two to six.
  • Added projects section which uses github api to fetch number of stars and forks each repo has.
  • Added participant projects consisting of javascript games made by them.
  • Added participant blogs describing each persons experince during the event.
  • Issues section which fetched all projects with label opencode and displayed them in the website.
  • Loader for the website, Better background images, Watch trailer and facebook likes , share and changed facebook graph images.
  • Chat box inside the website (gitter) , Countdown for the event and event scoreboard to view each persons commits.

The event had a total of 66 participants out of which 63 where from IIIT- Allahabad.

Humbefoolcup

Humbefoolcup was an event page which we made using materilizecss.
It started of with a simple materilizecss template. In the end we made :

  • A compelete event page
  • A tribute page, stats page and team page.

All the contributions was from the participants i only managed the page with the help of Diwakar.

Other projects

Other projects can be viewed at the projects section at opencodecollab website .

To increase the Participants we also conducted workshops on Git | Github and Android game Dev during the event.

Conslusion

In the beginning, the event attracted only few participants. But the number increased gradually, and as the event came to an end, we reached 66 participants with most of them from IIIT Allahabad. Together we created amazing things.

As compared to normal GCI which has around 100-150 participants we need a lot more participants to call it a huge succes , but for the first time this was considered to be fair. As our number of mentors, publicity and prize money was limited.

Things to improve :

  • Participants had limited knowledge projects that required different skills were not much touched , which was a big draw back. Such as Android App, Django based projects etc.
  • Bigger prize money and sponsors.
  • Larger reach , we need to extend the event to other colleges as well. Our target next time is to reach out to colleges which are far off so that they will also get to know more about opensource.
  • More mentors.

But overall it was one of the best one months i had in my B-Tech mentoring other students.Its all becasue of the Opencode team ,small but amazing for making it a success.

Thank you for reading :)

Gallery
entry.summary: A month long Open-Source event which i founded.

entry.title: Trip2Rishikesh
entry.content:
I went to Rishikesh from October 30 to November 3, 2016.

Rishikesh known as “the valley of saints” is an amazing place for both adventurers as well as people in search of Spiritual calling.This Blog post is about the former.

Table of Contents

  • How to reach ?
  • Riverside Night Camping
  • River Rafting
  • Bungee Jumping
  • Beatles Ashram
  • Others

The Trip

How to Reach?

To reach Rishikesh you have to first reach Haridwar or Dehradun. We reached Haridwar by train after realizing there is nothing much to do there we took a bus to Rishikesh. Which took almost 1.25 hours and is available 24 * 7 . You can also get Taxi’s or Auto’s.

Camping

After reaching we took a river side camp in Shivpuri near Rishikesh for the nights stay. The package included food,camping and free rafting on the next day.Food was great and nothing can ever match the ambiance of the atmosphere though. The Bon fire with with the cold winds from the Himalayas are something worth experiencing.

We had to wake up early in the morning to go for river rafting.

Rafting

River Rafting is one of the cheapest and most amazing things to do in Rishikesh.
We did a 18 km rafting which included few grade 3 and grade 4 Rapids. Being at the front of the raft i had an interesting journey.
During rafting they allow us to jump into River Ganges and do body floating(with their life jackets on). Which is basically the only time non swimmers can actually experience the beauty of the sport without putting in any effort(P.S i can swim). We stopped half way during the ride for a Tea break where people could do Cliff jumping , which is basically people jumping from a rock into the water. After which we rowed to the end point and finished our ride.

Bungee

The main purpose of this trip was to do Bungee Jumping at Jumpin heights which is an 83 meters long India’s highest jump with jump masters from New Zealand .
It costs around Rs 3600 for a jump which is same everywhere , so you dont have to roam around finding people to bargain with. It is of top quality and is worth every single penny of it. The Jumping place is around 20 km away from Rishikesh which rented a bike for the travel.

After the jump we have to do a small trek up the mountain we just jumped . The place also has Flying Fox and Giant Swing.

BeatlesAshram

Beatles Ashram is the place where the infamous Beatles stayed when they came to India. This is place is full of Graffiti and paintings which will make the artist within you fall in love.

Well that was a lot wasn’t it. There are more but i got tired of clicking pics. There are small caves and very old ashrams there also.

Others

There are many more interesting places like Ram Jhula, Lakshman Jhula , Triveni Ghat and many temples in Rishikesh too.But this post wont cover them.

Thank you for reading and i hope one day you will also visit there and try out everything.
entry.summary:
I went to Rishikesh from October 30 to November 3, 2016.

Rishikesh known as “the valley of saints” is an amazing place for both adventurers as well as people in search of Spiritual calling.This Blog post is about the former.

entry.title: Stegolica
entry.content:
Stegolica was held as part of Effervesence 2016 of IIIT Allahabad.

Steganography is the practice of concealing messages or information within other non-secret text or data.

This blog post contains all the questions and their solutions for the event.

Question

This book served as the primary basis for which film? (Haha blank image right, but look closer)

Answer:

bladerunner

Solution:

Tilt the screen in a certain viewing angle then you can see the text “ Do android dream of electric sheep”

Alternatively

Open in Photoeditor and apply any filter to the image. And you will get

Question

Whose line is this ?

Answer:

jerrymaguire

Solution: The line is “show me the money” from the movie jerry maguire.

If you zoom into the image closely you will see that the image is made of the text show me the money.

Question

Guess the hidden word i say when i get an idea for a question?

(PDF FILE)[https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By4wRKJ5_4qJNkpnOWxxS1U5ZmM/view]

Answer:

bazinga

Solution:

The text is in white colour in the pdf file. so open in any pdf editor and you can change the colour of the font or you can open in any pdf viwer and highlight all text and you see something like this.

BAZINGA

Question

Who is the man behind these companies? Video Question

Answer:

elonmusk

Solution:

If you play the video very slow then you will see these texts comming up and flashing away very quick, yeah like in fight club. You saw it but you didnt.

Solar City at 9:00.
Paypal at 22:17.
Zip2 at 40:17.
Paypal at 58:23.
Tesla at 1:08:10

Question

Which song am i talking about?
PSD File

which looks something like this (Institute Library)

Answer:

blankspace

Solution:

Open in Photoeditor.
Untick layers 2,3,4,5
Increase the opacity of the group from 0 to 100 ( Optional only needed in some photoeditors if you dont see the text yet)

you will see the text “OMG look at that face you look like my next mistake”. A line from the Taylor Swift song blank space.

Question

What is the blind mans last name ?

Audio File

Answer:

slade

Solution:
If you reverse the audio you will see that the audio track is from the movie “scent of a woman”.
Conversation/Speech between Mr Slade (Al Pacino as the Blind Man) and Mr Trask.

Audio File when reversed.

Full Speech

Question

Where is the key ?

Image file

The image looks like this ( Do not download this image to solve)

Answer:

withinyourself

Solution:
if you open the image in any text editor you will see.

Question

My fav personal assistant

Answer:

jarvis

Solution:

In image description you will find

Artist : multimillionaire,philantropist ,genius ,playboy which means Iron Man(Tony Stark)
Descritpion : Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (JARVIS)

Question

A Terrorist tweeted the next target location where ?

Answer:

tajmahal

Solution:

If you discrad all the text and only take numbers into consideration.

27 174 78 and 04 can be found.

We represent a location by numbers using latitude and longitude .

so 27.174 and 78.04 means taj mahal

Question

Which character says this ?(take e=2.718)

Image link

Answer :

buzzlightyear

Solution:

Change the extension of the image file from png to zip.
After extraction you will get.

Taking e ad 2.718 ,i.e taking 2nd 7th 1st and 8th image we get two, infinity , and , beyond respectively.

To infinity and beyond is by the toy story character buzzlightyear.

Question 12

Who is it?

Image Link

Image looks like, please use the above link to download .

Answer :

samuelljackson

Solution:

If you change the file extension to zip then unzip it you will get an image.
When you change its extension and unzip it , you will get another.
If you do this again and again you will get these images.
And in the final image when opened as a text file, it is given the solution is the actor who acted in all of these movies.

Question 13

From which movie is this dialogue

Audio link

Answer:

titanic

Solution:

The soundtrack is 528491 from the movie inception.

If you change the extension of the audio to zip from mp3 you will get this text file containing.

When you take the 5th 2nd 8th 4th 9th and 1st word of quotes in order you will get.
“i’m the king of the world” from the movie titanic

I need better hints

If you still need hints, i hid some images in my gauthamzz.github.io repo, search for it.

Thank you for reading

The source code to the website can be found at Stegolica Repo in my github account.

The webapp was developed using Django and hosted in openshift.
entry.summary:
Stegolica was held as part of Effervesence 2016 of IIIT Allahabad.

Steganography is the practice of concealing messages or information within other non-secret text or data.

This blog post contains all the questions and their solutions for the event.

entry.title: IIITAHacks
entry.content:
IIITA Hacks was organized as part of Technical Society from 10th to 11th September 2016. It was a 17 hour hackathon with a participation of 150 students from the Institute.

IIITA Hacks was an exclusive for the students of Indian Institute of Information Technology,Allahabad ,serving for the purpose for increasing the hackathon culture in the Institute. It also served as our odd semester hackthon complementing out even semester major hackthon Hack In the North, which i am also a part of. Hack In the North is presently india’s biggest student held hackthon.

Trailer

Posters

FAQ

The event

The event was organized on two labs of Computer Center 3 of IIIT-A.
Participants had to code for 17 hours followed by a presentation at Admin Audi of the Institute.

Inauguration

The event Rules and Regulations followed by team registration was done in front of CC3 at 9:00 pm on 10 th of September.
Teams had to register online on a google form previously. The teams were alloted one to two first years as extra help for their task in hand.

Coding

The Participants went to there alloted labs and started coding very soon.
Our organizers helped teams in fixing their minor bugs as they can. Teams were given free goodies on the spot by the Organisers to encourage them on thier effort.
Refreshments such as coffe,colddrinks and snacks were provided for the Participants during the event.

Presentation

After vigorous coding efforts the Participants then proceeded to Admin Audi.
All the teams were judged by Dr. Rahul Kala and winners were decided soon after it was over.
Top projects can be viewed here.

Winners: KrayZ

  • Indresh Attri - IIT20150121
  • Rajatbir Singh Bajwa - RIT2015012
  • Piyush Gurnule - IEC2016026
  • Nakul Srivastava - IIT2016056
  • Madhur Gupta IIT2016083

I had a lot of fun organizing one of the Institute’s largest hackthon’s till date. It had around 300 applications ,150 Participants and more than 20 final projects. I hope it will be better the next version.

Thank you for reading.

View more images at AMS album
entry.summary: IIITA Hacks was a Student held hackathon organized by me from 10th September 2016.

entry.title: GeekhavenMentorship
entry.content:
Task 3.0

  1. All of you had been added to the github repository
  2. Find out awesome designs from all over internet like particle.js etc .You can use websites like CODEPEN for them.
  3. Categorically arrange them like other awesome lists by editing the Readme.md as icons,background etc ..
  4. special points for using git rather than github. :) The above one is just a fun project for you guys :) So only add awesome ones and have fun exploring.
  5. Write a code in c/c++/python to Read from a file and display as output.
  6. Write a code in c/c++/python to write to a file a given text.
  7. Try to learn how to compile in c99, change the output file from ./a.out to any name
Happy Diwali Guys have fun :)

Deadline : Nov 7 Updated: Oct 28

Task 2.0

  1. Create a repository in your github account ,name it “mentorshipcodes”
  2. Write a c code to check if the number is prime or not
  3. Write a c/python code to make a calculator
  4. write a c/python code to make a word game using python, which could be a quiz game , chatting game etc ..
  5. Upload this file into the repository.

Deadline is 11th Oct 2016

Task 1.0

We will start with two things:

  1. All of you should make a github profile and send me the link.
  2. All of you should make a personal website and push to a repository names “your username”. After this you will be able to visit that website in yourusername.github.io .

General personal website making instructions.

  1. You can use a bootstarp template and edit them to your needs. Some of them are startbootstrap , get bootstrap or just google it. Anything is fine with me.
  2. Basic html and css could be looked up W3schools website.
  3. When facing an error always look up in Google. Your BEST FRIEND for the next few years in college.

General Github instructions

  1. Read through this Github 10 min read post
  2. You dont need to learn everything. Just learn the things you need. Go through this website if you still cant do it.
  3. For your task you need to push into the repository created and send a pull request :p . Look those up in Google as well.

FYI: your deadline is 17 Saturday Sep 2016 .
entry.summary: This blog post is for the freshers who are doing Geekhaven mentorship under me.I will update this post on regular interval to inform you new things you have to do.

entry.title: HackInTheNorth
entry.content:
Even the term Hackathon was a new one for a lot of people in Allahabad. If i had a penny for every time i herd what is a Hackathon i would be a very rich guy. But even in this situation we made it happen. And i am proud of being part of this wonderful team.
It was held as part of our tech fest Aparoksha and beginning itself it was decided it would be our flagship event.Due to the support from our sponsors Hackerearth , Mozilla and our faculty we raised enough funds to make it happen.

View website

All the participants had to do was take the first train to Allahabad with your laptop and we will provide you everything you want to hack . Participant were provided accommodation , food , T shirts and goodies :).

We had more than 140 participants from all over India and most of them traveled at least 500 Kms. While talking to them i learned a lot about the things that are happening all over India. And watching them develop truly magnificent peaces of “art” (What they made looked like art) made me realize how much i can achieve in 3 days . And most of them taught me the valuable lesson of how to approach to a particular solution.

Our judge Hackerearth CTO Vivek Prakash said he had never seen a student held Hackathon like this before and said

“Hack in the north is India’s biggest student held Hackathon “

truly made all of our in the team happy. Receiving this much recognition even in our first run.

The winners of the Hackathon made Castle Defence : Multiplayer game and generic android controller. They were really cool guys from MNIT Allahabad. I even saw them changing and adapting to the situation and in the end it all worked out well. I guess its all about perseverance, adaptability and hard-work. After all commitment is what transforms a promise into reality .All of the teams attended in the event were truly exceptional and our team wanted to give prices to all of them but right now they have to settle with t shirts.

This experience was an amazing one for me and it wouldn’t have been so great without our team making it possible. I hope we can make next years Hackathon an even better one. I am sure we can with this team.

view original medium post

view more images

Thank you for reading :).
entry.summary: IIIT-Allahabad’s first ever Hackathon that became india’s biggest student held hackathon.
